title: Laws of Motion Test 1
description: Conceptual and numerical questions on Newton’s Laws, friction, and tension in strings.

questions.question_text: A block of mass 5 kg rests on a smooth horizontal surface. A force of 20 N is applied on it. Find its acceleration using \( F = ma \).

Two blocks A and B of masses 3 kg and 2 kg are connected by a light string and placed on a smooth horizontal surface. A force of 10 N acts on A. Find the tension in the string. \( a = \frac{F}{m_A + m_B} \)
A 10 kg body is suspended by a string from a ceiling. Find the tension in the string when the body is moving upward with acceleration \( 2 m/s^2 \). Use \( T = m(g + a) \).
A block of 10 kg is placed on a rough surface (\( \mu = 0.3 \)). A horizontal force of 20 N acts on it. Find the acceleration if \( g = 10 m/s^2 \).
A body is pulled by a force making 30° with the horizontal. The tension in the string is 50 N. Find horizontal component of the force. \( F_x = F \cos(30°) \)
